plot.name: Thugs attack Harriet
plot.description:
The betrothed lady for the third prince gets very jealous hearing about Harriet all the time from him. She has her butler pay 3 ruffians to attempt to kidnap/beat up/kill Harriet. They ultimately fail, and Harriet's betrothed discovers it was her who ordered the hit.
After Harriet returns from her funeral trip, Harriet becomes apoplectic about it, and confronts her. Harriet threatens her life if she touches someone of her family again.
Harriet's betrothed orders her retinue to take a trip over the summer to cool off. During this time the prince's betrothed starts spreading vicious rumors about Harriet.
plot.result:
Harriet and the third prince's betrothed become bitter enemies. She doesn't attempt again to physically hurt Harriet, but uses her power to defame her and try to get her expelled.
Does Harriet declare a duel? Fight the prince? What should be the resolution here?

plot.name: Charming the eastern king's court
plot.description: Harriet shows up to pay the ransom, and the count watching over her betrothed is immediately charmed by her force of will and determination. Asks her to teach his daugthers the sword, since in this kingdom it is not customary. He manages to get the king to invite them to his castle, where he asks for a demonstration. She chooses the plainest rapier from a table of weapons, unbeknoiwnst to her that it was the king's hidden family heirloom. She fights the head of the king's guard, who is ordered to only defend. She goes all out, and at one point stops defending herself and leaves herself open. The guard captain starts feeling pressured and eventually kicks her away from himself. During the fight, the rapier sword she uses starts to sing. guard captain is apologetic king is impressed, along with his guest a southern prince on a diplomatic tour he gives her the sword

plot.name: Heading south to "cool off"
plot.description: The irony of heading south to cool off is not lost on Harriet

plot.name: Her new retainers setup an intelligence network
Her new retainers start spreading rumors about her
Raising the next generation
plot.description: While in the southlands, Harriet decides to bring on 2 new maids and 2 new squires for her retainers to train. She visits an orphanage at a church and lines up the girls of age. She notices a dark eyed girl gently hide a second girl behind her. She likes her moxie, and decides to take them both. She asks them if they like any of the boys, the priest gives her names of two boys they are thick as thieves with. She asks they be brought, and tells them she is going to take the two girls to be maids for her, and that if they like, they may join them as squires for her retainers. One boy is more bookish/stocky, one is very thin. Should one be attuned to magic?

plot.name: Training the count's daughters/charming the dwarf weaponsmith
plot.description:
lets them try different swords gives them basics after her dinner with the king, goes to the forge in town dwarf tries to get her to buy the gaudy show weapons she wants the ones fit for adventurers, because she knows those are better he reassess her, notices the sword at her side looks at it, wide-eyed Finds out who she is, where she's from. shows her to the back where he forges both fancy and plain swords helps the girls pick out their swords, tells them to try them out, looks at their stances, says he will rebalance them for their hands and to come back in a few days
When they return, the sign says closed, but the door is open he is packing to move Asks her if she is going to be returning home soon she tells him where ah so my information was right Asks where he is going, he says to her hometown wants to follow her to see what happens with her and that sword the last time it walked the earth, it forged a kingdom

plot.name: The betrothed rout was a setup
plot.description: The route in the east was a setup - the second prince took a bunch of forces from nobles who didn't support him as his frontline troops, and left them there to be killed, while keeping those loyal to him close by and leaving when they could cause the most damage.

plot.name: Harriet and Betrothed relationship
plot.description:
Have met a few times at younger ages. 10, 16 13, 19 at his graduation from the academy
He has been spending his time on campaign and working his fathers lands, hasn't seen her since graduation (?)

plot.name: The Sword of Thorns tries to control Harriet
plot.description:
As Harriet fights the assassins in the south, she starts behaving more and more cruel - instead of a knockout blow, she cuts them/stabs them repeatedly. Even after they surrender she continues to cut them.
Her retainers see it as just desserts for assassins. Her fiance sees this behavior and is appalled by how dishonorable it is.
When she returns home, the dwarf smith tells her it is a magical sword, has a soul carved into it that loves to fight/hurt/kill, and a weak wielder will be dominated and turned into a monster who craves bloodlust.
If you can control the sword, it will allow you do to wonderful things.
Sword won't be fully sentient, just feelings and urges.

plot.name: Southern Prince Assassination Attempt
plot.description:
Assassins try to kill the southern prince
Harriet and her retinue warn her about poisons on the blades, but the southern assassins take great offense at this. Their guild considers poisons the weapon of cowards, and would never poison their blade.
